tool.name: correctGCBias
tool.description: uses the output from computeGCBias to generate corrected BAM files
tool.command:
#import tempfile #set $temp_dir = os.path.abspath(tempfile.mkdtemp())
#set $temp_bam_handle = tempfile.NamedTemporaryFile( dir=$temp_dir ) #set $temp_bam_path = $temp_bam_handle.name + '.bam' #silent $temp_bam_handle.close() #silent os.system("ln -s %s %s" % (str($bamInput), $temp_bam_path)) #silent os.system("ln -s %s %s.bai" % (str($bamInput.metadata.bam_index), $temp_bam_path))
correctGCBias --bamfile '$temp_bam_path' --species '$species' --GCbiasFrequenciesFile $GCbiasFrequenciesFile
#if $source.ref_source=="history": --genome $source.input1 #else: --genome "${source.input1_2bit.fields.path}" #end if
#if $advancedOpt.showAdvancedOpt == "yes": #if str($advancedOpt.region.value) != '': --region '$advancedOpt.region' #end if
--binSize '$advancedOpt.binSize' #end if
#set newoutFileName="corrected."+str($outFileFormat)
--correctedFile $newoutFileName; mv $newoutFileName $outFileName

param.name: bamInput
param.label: Input BAM file
param.help: This should be same file that was used for computeGCbias. The BAM file must be sorted.

param.name: input1_2bit
param.label: Using reference genome
param.help: If your genome of interest is not listed, contact your Galaxy team

param.name: input1
param.label: Select a reference dataset in 2bit format

param.name: region
param.label: Region of the genome to limit the operation to
param.help: This is useful when testing parameters to reduce the computing time. The format is chr:start:end, for example "chr10" or "chr10:456700:891000"

param.name: binSize
param.label: Bin size in bp
param.help: Size of the bins in bp for the ouput of the bigwig/bedgraph file.

tool.help:
**What it does**
This tool requires the output from computeGCBias to correct the given BAM files according to the method proposed by Benjamini and Speed (2012). Nucleic Acids Res. The resulting BAM files can be used in any downstream analyses, but be aware that you should not filter out duplicates from here on. -----
